item.title: A-League star cleared of COVID media breach
item.description: Brisbane Roar striker Scott McDonald has been cleared of a potential breach of the A-League’s COVID-19 protocols.

item.title: MAFS star charged over virus restrictions
item.description: Married At First Sight star Stacey Hampton is facing three charges of breaching coronavirus restrictions after going on an interstate shopping trip when she should have been self-isolating.

item.title: COVID zoom tweet sparks anger
item.description: A Labor MP’s tweet about a Zoom meeting has sparked a series of angry responses from opposing politicians, claiming they are continuing to be left out of vital COVID-19 briefings.

item.title: Fraudster now ‘can’t get job as Uber driver’
item.description: A disgraced Victorian bureaucrat formerly responsible for a budget of billions now can’t get a job as an Uber driver, a court heard on Friday.

item.title: Paddy and Zak back for crack at Bombers
item.description: The inclusion of ruckman Paddy Ryder and speedster Zak Jones for St Kilda’s clash with Essendon on Sunday were the easy decisions for coach Brett Ratten.

item.title: Family to killer: ‘How could you?’
item.description: The family of Adrian Trett, whose fatally injured body was found abandoned on a footpath at Mannum, has tearfully told how his killer fronted up to his funeral, shook their hands and offered condolences.

item.title: ‘Inexplicable’ error led to cruise virus disaster
item.description: The “low risk” rating of the ill-fated Ruby Princess sent a signal to “do nothing” as the virus-ridden cruise ship docked in Sydney and was an inexplicable and unjustifiable mistake, an inquiry has found.

item.title: Interest rate to stay at record low for 3 years
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia has flagged keeping the official interest rate at a historical low for the next three years, expecting it will take at least that long for the jobs market to recover from the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Lawyer called in to investigate SBS racism
item.description: An independent lawyer has been called in to investigate allegations of racism and bullying at SBS, after current and former staff spoke out publicly about the culture at the nation’s multicultural broadcaster.

item.title: Pat Cummins VC for locked in Aussie tour of England
item.description: Australia will play three ODIs and three T20s against England in September after confirmation of a return to international cricket for coach Justin Langer’s men.
